My Work

Personal and Group Projects:

VR-Art-Gallery

  • Conditionally rendered textures, artwork, and music on a-frame entities based on user selections in gallery creation.
  • Virtual Reality environment was created with the following technologies: A-frame, aframe-react, aframe-extras, aframe-physics-system, aframe-room-component, aframe-star-system-component.
  • Secure user registration via Bcryptjs.
  • Features similar to a social networking site: favoriting galleries and sharing galleries publicly, or privatizing galleries that are accessible by link only.
  • Redux used as solution to runtime error in passing data to A-frame's asset management system.
  • react-dropzone, aws-sdk, uui, and attr-accept technologies were used for users to upload their images as either gallery thumbnails or artwork within their galleries.

VR-Art-Gallery is a full stack, mobile-responsive, virtual reality application built in React and deployed in Preact where users can upload images into their own custom art galleries to display to the world. As a user, you customize your two-story gallery with texture presets for the floors and walls, and choose your own gallery music (all songs were performed by Kevin Macleod). Additionally, you can favorite other galleries, share their links, or create private galleries that are only accessible by the link you provide.

Live Project Github

Checked

  • Can register via Bcrypt for securely salted and hashed password protection.
  • Profile page allows users to change profile icon to Knight, King, Queen, Rook, or Bishop.
  • PostgreSQL used as database for storing user information and game history.
  • Can challenge online opponents in Arena view on profile and both will be programmatically redirected to gameboard
  • Socket.io was used for multiplayer interactivity over the board, updating movelist, and to allow users to chat with one another in real-time.
  • Users will be redirected to profile page upon checkmate.
  • Entire app was styled using SASS, and About page includes flip container transformations on team description cards.

A multiplayer chess application built for chess enthusiasts and those interested in playing real-time chess. Uses socket.io for multiplayer interactivity and chat features between opponents, uses massive, express, and postgreSQL, for keep tracking of users, game history, and general user info such as wins/losses, rating, and the highest rated players on the site.

Live Project Github

Socket.io Chat

  • The final product of a training exercise I put together for my co-workers to showcase the basics of client to server connection via socket.io.
  • Highlights how to build a node server, serving static files via express, and making a client-to-server connection with socket.io.
  • Built in vanilla JS, CSS, and HTML
  • Demonstrates two basic concepts of socket connection: broadcast.emit vs emit.
  • Broadcast meaning all connected clients will receive the message (user and message in this example), including the sender, and emit meaning that all clients except for the sender will receive the message (`${user} is typing...` example in this case).

This was the final product of a training exercise I crafted for my coworkers during my time at Bright Bridge Web. All employees are required to give a training, and I chose socket.io as I believe it's an essential technology for all modern web developers to know. The aim of this project was to show a step-by-step process of how to setup socket.io on the client and server, following the construction of a node server, and to understand how the client and server communicate with one another via sockets. The styling and DOM querying was provided.

Live Project Github

Connect Four

  • Turn-based, hotseat Connect Four game.
  • Once user starts game, Tokens can be moved using left and right arrows keys, and they can be dropped using the down arrow key.
  • Keeps track of Game state (player's turn, remaining tokens, if four tokens are connected horizontally, vertically, or diagonally, declaring winner, Spaces in board occupied with a token, and etc.)
  • App was constructed with OOP principles in mind: Encapsulation, Abstraction, Polymorphism, and Inheritance.
  • Direct link to source code.

A project presented on TeamTreeHouse for users to test their understanding of Object-Oriented Programming principles. The user is tasked with constructing classes for each facet of the game: Board, Spaces, Tokens, Players, and general Game logic and state. The logic behind this was simple; however, the clarity and readability within this project was the main objective throughout this project. I've included a direct link to the JS files above.

Live Project Github

Basic JavaScript Chess AI

  • Play a chess script that generates its moves based on board evaluation, a minimax algorithm, and alpha beta pruning.
  • Displays SAN (Standard Algorithmic Notation) with a copy-to-clipboard function for further analysis in a chess GUI like Fritz.
  • Undo button to revert board state to previous position.
  • Displays how many positions evaluated, evaluation time, and how many positions evaluated per second.

This is an ongoing personal project of mine. I'm fascinated with the game of chess, and this was largely an attempt at understanding minMax algorithms based on a tutorial I found online. It's my hope to one day create a script that plays at a 2000 ELO performance or better. Things I hope to include in this script in the future: Understanding of King Safety (Castling appropriately), an Opening book (with selectable openings by the user), and prophylactic awareness.
